options.content: This view has been designed to show current values in real-time. Auto-refresh, Time Range and Aggregations have been pre-set to give you the best experience without impacting the server. You are free to modify these values but be aware of the following: Increasing time range without increasing aggregation can create excessive load on the SQL Server and increasing aggregation may hide details by smoothing out charts. Different metrics work with different aggregations, for example, you can average CPU but latencies best work with max values. Waits should be summarised for each period as there are many of them etc.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
      [time] = $__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation) 
      ,metric = [counter_name]
      ,[value] = AVG([cntr_value_calculated])
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_perf_os_performance_counters]
  WHERE [aggregation_interval_minutes] = 1
   AND $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
   AND counter_name IN ('Batch Requests/sec','Readahead pages/sec','Transactions/sec','Processes blocked')
   AND [sql_instance] IN ($sql_instance)
   GROUP BY counter_name, $__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation) 
ORDER BY
  time ASC

SELECT 
      [time] = $__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation) 
      ,[Latency] = MAX([io_latency_read]+[io_latency_write])
      ,metric='Latency'
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_perf_file_stats]
  WHERE 1 = 1
  AND $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
  AND [sql_instance] IN ($sql_instance)
  GROUP BY $__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation) 
ORDER BY
  time ASC

SELECT 
      [time] = $__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation) 
      ,metric = 'Wait Time'
      ,[value] = sum([wait_time_ms_per_second])
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_perf_os_wait_stats]
  WHERE 1=1
  AND $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
  AND [sql_instance] IN ($sql_instance)
  GROUP BY $__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation) 
ORDER BY
  time ASC

SELECT 
      [time] = $__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation) 
      ,[Bytes Transferred] = AVG([bytes_written_per_second]+[bytes_read_per_second])
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_perf_file_stats]
  WHERE 1 = 1
  AND $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
  AND [sql_instance] IN ($sql_instance)
  GROUP BY $__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation)
ORDER BY
  time ASC

SELECT [time] = $__timeGroup(h.[snapshot_time], $aggregation) 
      , [Long Processes] = count(distinct session_id)
  FROM dbo.sqlwatch_logger_snapshot_header h
    left join [dbo].[sqlwatch_logger_xes_long_queries] d
		on  h.snapshot_time = d.[snapshot_time]
		and h.snapshot_type_id = d.snapshot_type_id
		and h.sql_instance = d.sql_instance
  WHERE h.snapshot_type_id = 7
   AND h.[sql_instance] IN ($sql_instance)
   AND $__timeFilter(h.snapshot_time)
  group by $__timeGroup(h.[snapshot_time], $aggregation) 
ORDER BY
  time desc

SELECT top 1 [time]=$__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation) 
,[SQL Instance]=count(h.sql_instance)
  FROM dbo.sqlwatch_logger_snapshot_header h
  where snapshot_type_id = 1
    AND h.[sql_instance] IN ($sql_instance)
   AND $__timeFilter(h.snapshot_time)
  group by $__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation)

SELECT [time] = getdate(),
 [Checks] = max(case 
		when last_check_status = 'OK' then 0
		when last_check_status = 'WARNING' then 1
		when last_check_status = 'CRITICAL' then 2
		else 3 end)
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_dim_check]
     WHERE [sql_instance] IN ($sql_instance)
     AND check_enabled = 1

SELECT 
      [time] = $__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation) 
      ,[SQL Memory] = AVG([physical_memory_in_use_kb]*1.0/([physical_memory_in_use_kb]+[available_commit_limit_kb]))
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_perf_os_process_memory]
  WHERE 1 = 1
  AND $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
  AND [sql_instance] IN ($sql_instance)
  GROUP BY $__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation) 
ORDER BY
  time ASC

SELECT 
      [time] = $__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation) 
      ,[Pending] = MAX([runnable_tasks_count]+work_queue_count+pending_disk_io_count)
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_perf_os_schedulers]
  WHERE 1 = 1
  AND $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
  AND [sql_instance] IN ($sql_instance)
  GROUP BY $__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation) 
ORDER BY
  time ASC

SELECT 
      [time] = $__timeGroup(t.[snapshot_time], $aggregation)
      ,'CPU Usage %' = avg(t.[cntr_value_calculated])
  FROM (SELECT 
	 snapshot_time
	,[cntr_value_calculated]=sum(pc.[cntr_value_calculated])
	FROM [dbo].[sqlwatch_logger_perf_os_performance_counters] pc
		inner join [dbo].[sqlwatch_meta_performance_counter] mpc
			on pc.sql_instance = mpc.sql_instance
			and pc.performance_counter_id = mpc.performance_counter_id  
	WHERE $__timeFilter(pc.snapshot_time)
	AND mpc.counter_name IN ('CPU usage %')
	AND pc.instance_name NOT IN ('internal')
	AND pc.[sql_instance] IN ($sql_instance)
	GROUP BY snapshot_time) t
  GROUP BY $__timeGroup(t.[snapshot_time], $aggregation)
ORDER BY
  time ASC

SELECT
      [time] = $__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation) 
      ,metric = [counter_name]
      ,[value] = AVG([cntr_value_calculated])
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_perf_os_performance_counters]
  WHERE [aggregation_interval_minutes] = 1
   AND $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
   AND counter_name IN ('Batch Requests/sec','Readahead pages/sec','Transactions/sec','Processes blocked')
   AND [sql_instance] IN ($sql_instance)
   GROUP BY counter_name, $__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation)

  time ASC

      [time] = $__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation)

  AND [sql_instance] IN ($sql_instance)
  GROUP BY $__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation)

  time ASC

      [time] = $__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation) 
      ,metric = 'Wait Time'
      ,[value] = sum([wait_time_ms_per_second])
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_perf_os_wait_stats]
  WHERE 1=1

  AND [sql_instance] IN ($sql_instance)

ORDER BY
  time ASC

      [time] = $__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation)

      , [Long Processes] = count(distinct session_id)
